divs: Sighting DetailsWhile camping up near Geneva park near Grant Colorado, I got up around 3:30 to go to the bathroom (in the woods). I felt a bit anxious when I woke up. I noticed my brother who I was camping with was feeling a bit on edge too so we both decided to get some fresh air. The Milky Way was the brightest, most defined I'd ever seen it - it was an amazingly clear, crisp dark night with tons of stars. As I'm looking SW at the Galaxy belt I see an intense bright light out the corner of my eye toward the south come out of nowhere. It is brighter and larger than anything in the sky. Once I looked directly at it it appeared to be coming down toward me without any horizontal movement. It made no noise and it looked like it would if were a police helicopter shining it's spotlight straight down at you. I remember being stunned by this and wondering what was going to happen next. This lasted for maybe 8 to 10 seconds before the light dissipated to the brightness of a small, dim star. As the light dimmed it began to move NW in the sky as if it were a satellite. I followed it for about 20 seconds before it was no longer visible and faded away into the sky. I'm not sure what it could have been. I thought that maybe it could have been a satellite catching a very intense reflection of the sun. However, I've never seen or heard of a satellite stopping mid flight and then continuing on again impossible at those speeds. I have seen similar sightings before but this was a bit spookier than the others. Weird!
